options.content: This is a generated dashboard. Any changes made here will be lost on the next generation.

targets.expr: sum(zfs_dataset_used_bytes{instance=~"$instance", pool=~"$pool"}) by (name, pool, type) / sum(zfs_dataset_quota_bytes{instance=~"$instance", pool=~"$pool"}) by (name, pool, type)

panels.title: Pool Deduplication Ratio
panels.description: The ratio of deduplicated size vs undeduplicated size for data in this pool.

panels.title: Pool Fragmentation Ratio
panels.description: The fragmentation ratio of the pool.

panels.title: Pool Health
panels.description: Health status code for the pool [0: online, 1: degraded, 2: faulted, 3: offline, 4: unavailable, 5: removed, 6: suspended].

panels.title: Pool Leaked
panels.description: Number of leaked bytes in the pool.

panels.title: Pool Readonly
panels.description: Read-only status of the pool [0: read-write, 1: read-only].

panels.title: Pool Size
panels.description: Total size in bytes of the storage pool.

panels.title: Pool Free
panels.description: The amount of free space in bytes available in the pool.

panels.title: Pool Freeing
panels.description: The amount of space in bytes remaining to be freed following the destruction of a file system or snapshot.

panels.title: Pool Expand Size
panels.description: Amount of uninitialized space within the pool or device that can be used to increase the total capacity of the pool.

panels.title: Pool Allocated
panels.description: Amount of storage in bytes used within the pool.

targets.expr: sum(zfs_dataset_used_bytes{instance=~"$instance", pool=~"$pool"}) by (name, pool, type) / sum(zfs_dataset_quota_bytes{instance=~"$instance", pool=~"$pool"}) by (name, pool, type)

panels.title: Dataset Available
panels.description: The amount of space in bytes available to the dataset and all its children.

panels.title: Dataset Logical Used
panels.description: The amount of space in bytes that is "logically" consumed by this dataset and all its descendents. See the "used_bytes" property.

panels.title: Dataset Quota
panels.description: The maximum amount of space in bytes this dataset and its descendents can consume.

panels.title: Dataset Used By
panels.description: The amount of space in bytes used by this dataset itself, which would be freed if the dataset were destroyed.

panels.title: Dataset Used
panels.description: The amount of space in bytes consumed by this dataset and all its descendents.

panels.title: Dataset Written
panels.description: The amount of referenced space in bytes written to this dataset since the previous snapshot.

panels.title: Dataset Referenced
panels.description: The amount of data in bytes that is accessible by this dataset, which may or may not be shared with other datasets in the pool.
